channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8666] META region isn't fully recovered during master initialization when META region recovery had chained failures
item.description: In distributedLogReplay mode when Meta recovery had experienced chained failures(recovery failed multiple times in a row), META region can't be fully recovered during master starts up.
item.summary: META region isn't fully recovered during master initialization when META region recovery had chained failures

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:

+1
nit:


+      // splitMetaLog is all right. If a server doesn't have .meta wal, there is no op for the

'.meta' -> '.META.'

Incorporated Ted's comments and reworked the fix a little bit to handle one more case where when all region servers are down, SSH tries to assignMeta and will fail because there is no available RS. After that master restarts, in that situation oldMetaLocation=null which will skip meta recovering.

This message is automatically generated.

few comments.

+ need to use union of previouslyFailedMetaRSs recorded in ZK and previouslyFailedServers

In what scenarios would previouslyFailedServers not suffice alone? Will previouslyFailedMetaRSs not be a subset of previouslyFailedServers.

+ private volatile long lastRecoveringNodeCreationTime = 0;

Something similar in removeRecoveringRegionsFromZK() too?

In what scenarios would previouslyFailedServers not suffice alone? Will previouslyFailedMetaRSs not be a subset of previouslyFailedServers.

When I run tests and killed RS and Master in random order, I end up with previouslyFailedMetaRSs isn't part of previouslyFailedServers. The end result is bad because META can't be out of recovering state. So comes the v3 patch which can make sure .META. will be out of recovering state even data integrity has broken before master starts up.

Something similar in removeRecoveringRegionsFromZK() too?

The reason to initialize the removeRecoveringRegionsFromZK to 0 is to let recovering region GC run once after master is initialized to remove possible stale recovering regions. The call will be trigged inside TimeoutMonitor#removeRecoveringRegionsFromZK(null, null);. This change is a nice to have one.

Thanks.

I end up with previouslyFailedMetaRSs isn't part of previouslyFailedServers

How can this happen? Is this okay? May be because log replaying/splitting of the RS which was hosting meta is clear by the time master was initialized (and therefore getFailedServersFromLogFolders() couldn't find it?)

lastRecoveringNodeCreationTime

Right. That's why I commented that would lastRecoveringNodeCreationTime be reset to 0 instead of Long.MAXIMUM in removeRecoveringRegionsFromZK once all such znodes are cleared?

How can this happen? Is this okay? May be because log replaying/splitting of the RS which was hosting meta is clear by the time master was initialized (and therefore getFailedServersFromLogFolders() couldn't find it?)

Might be or it may due to the fact that I killed Master right before it could delete the recovering META from ZK while the same server still has non-meta wal to be replayed so that the HMaster#removeStaleRecoveringRegionsFromZK can't delete the stale META region.

Right. That's why I commented that would lastRecoveringNodeCreationTime be reset to 0 instead of Long.MAXIMUM in removeRecoveringRegionsFromZK once all such znodes are cleared?

I see your point now. This is a good question. Below is the related code 


        // no splitting work items left

        deleteRecoveringRegionZNodes(null);

        // reset lastRecoveringNodeCreationTime because we cleared all recovering znodes at

        // this point.

        lastRecoveringNodeCreationTime = Long.MAX_VALUE;

The reason I set lastRecoveringNodeCreationTime=Long.MAX_VALUE is that after deleteRecoveringRegionZNodes call, all recovering regions are removed. So there is no need to run the GC process every one second especially it adds some read traffic to ZK because nothing to be GCed.
We only need the GC by the time a new split work is scheduled where lastRecoveringNodeCreationTime will be set to current time again.

Initializing the removeRecoveringRegionsFromZK to 0 is because during master start up, the previous state is gone we don't know if we need to run GC or not. So just trigger it once after master initialization in case we have orphan items to be cleared. After the GC called once and lastRecoveringNodeCreationTime=Long.MAX_VALUE, the GC stops till we have new recovery work items coming in.

Thanks for replying.

nit: bq. re union of listing master regionservrs with dead regionservers, you could cite this as a possible reason as to why a union is needed. Might be helpful for future readers

re: lastRecoveringNodeCreationTime
yes, it sounds good.
The v4 patch has a comment modification per Himanshu Vashishtha's feedback. Thanks for the reviewing!
